citation.article-title: Catenovulum agarivorans gen. nov., sp. nov., a peritrichously flagellated, chain-forming, agar-hydrolysing gammaproteobacterium from seawater
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Catenovulum [Ca.te.no′vu.lum. L. fem. n. catena chain; N.L. dim. neut. n. ovulum (from L. n. ovum an egg) a small egg; N.L. neut. n. Catenovulum chain egg].
Cells with peritrichous flagella are rod-shaped and form long chains end-to-end.
Possess an absolute requirement for Na+ ions and fail to grow when Na+ ions are replaced with K+ ions.
Seawater salts are not required for growth.
Negative for Voges–Proskauer test and H2S and indole production.
PE and PG are the major constituents of the phospholipids, with small amounts of PN and two unknown phospholipids.
Predominant cellular fatty acids are C16 : 0, C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH, C18 : 1ω7c and C10 : 0 3-OH.
Phylogenetically, the genus belongs to the Gammaproteobacteria.
The type species is Catenovulum agarivorans.
